column4: hi ubuntu keeps finding internal errors, first it was with apt-get, then something to do with perl, then that seemed to fix itself, firefox is consistently crashing, (even after update today) and now theres another apt problem, you think theres a deeper problem going on?
does firefox crash straight away or only when you open a flash page?
typically straight away
and what gives you a sudo apt-get upgrade in a terminal?
did you add any extra repositories?
theres an indicator applet on the top panel saying an error occurred when searching for updates, ill just try sudo
nope, chrome is having trouble displaying webpages now though
it just stalls like last time in the terminal, ceases to do anything
ive run rkhunter and everything seems okay, chkrootkit too, but it seems like alot of things are breaking at once
can it be that your HDD is braking?
breaking
actually yes, seems though im having hang at boot issues, ive had to do several hard shutdowns
and its a second HDD, couldve handled it rough
then hurry up, start from a live system a save your important data, then do a hdd check
no idea how to a hdd check, btw im using gnome-panel not unity, i guess thats not gonna have anything to do with apt though
create a USB stick with a live system, boot from it and then you can check the HDD with e2fsck
ah right thanks :), will do, presume i can pop the live system on a CD tho if USB doesnt work?
Yes
USB is just more convenient an uses less resources :)
is e2fsck a CLI tool?
Yes
